Caption: Figure 8. Regular alignments.
Mention:
Tension Lines. Arnheim argues in his work that people 
attend to regular alignments of geometric primitives, 
particularly horizontal and vertical alignments (Arnheim 
1974). In Figure 8a the circle is perceived to be “out of 
balance,” while placing it on one of the dashed lines in 8b 
would create a more “stable” configuration:
